result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa L Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Fraud, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alyssa L Cole

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Memo from Agent Ashley Brooks dated March 16, 2017 - defendant has paid her court obligations and has completed all conditions of probation and will discharge as scheduled
Probation review hearing on March 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
1:19 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privet.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to misdemeanor theft by fraud.  Statement by ADA - agrees to amend to misdemeanor theft by fraud if restitution was paid and restitution has been paid in full.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to the amended charge.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 1:25 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

10:55 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - received an offer with restitution to be paid and restitution has been paid in full.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 12, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:56 a.m.

10:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant is working on getting the restitution to pay up front.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 29, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:53 a.m.

10:59 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

Court takes a short recess for DA to get the file.  Court reconvenes at 11:03 a.m.  Same appearances.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 19, 2016 at 11:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:03 a.m.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:40 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 15, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:42 a.m.

Per Atty Privat - she has been appointed on this case and requests the court set for status hearing on her time block.
43
